snippet: Although the Internet has remained relatively free in Malaysia, most major newspapers are either owned by the government or linked to it.
abstract: Malaysian court rules that the government should not have rejected an application for a print publication license by popular independent news Web site Malaysiakini; under Malaysian law, a newspaper must obtain a permit from the government before it can publish; free-speech advocates hail the decision as a victory, as few new permits have been granted in recent years.
lead_paragraph: Although the Internet has remained relatively free in Malaysia, most major newspapers are either owned by the government or linked to it.

headline.seo: Malaysian Court Says Publishing a Newspaper Is a Right
headline.main: In Malaysia, Court Backs Right to Print a Newspaper
headline.print_headline: In Malaysia, Court Backs Right to Print A Newspaper
